list.name: Fungal Flu
list.effect: 1d4 Con. Rolling a 1 on any Fortitude save to resist taking damage from fungal flu results in blindness. The blindness persists - even resisting spells like remove blindness/deafness - until the disease is cured.
description: **Effect** 1d4 Con. Rolling a 1 on any Fortitude save to resist taking damage from fungal flu results in blindness. The blindness persists - even resisting spells like remove blindness/deafness - until the disease is cured.

list.name: Leprosy
list.effect: 1d2 Cha damage
description: **Type** contact, inhaled, or injury; **Fortitude Save* DC 12 ((negates; DC 20 to avoid effects))

list.name: Mindfire
list.effect: 1d4 Int damage

list.name: Ghoul Fever
list.effect: 1d3 Con and 1d3 Dex damage
description: A humanoid who dies of ghoul fever rises as a [ghoul](monster:ghoul) at the next midnight. A humanoid who becomes a ghoul in this way retains none of the abilities it possessed in life. It is not under the control of any other ghouls, but it hungers for the flesh of the living and behaves like a normal ghoul in all respects. A humanoid of 4 Hit Dice or more rises as a ghast. The save DC is Charisma-based.

list.name: Green Haze
list.effect: -4 on Perception checks, target is permanently blinded if it fails 3 saves
description: **Effect** -4 on Perception checks, target is permanently blinded if it fails 3 saves

list.name: Shakes
list.effect: 1d8 Dex damage

list.name: Brainworms
list.effect: 1d3 Wis damage and 1d3 Int damage, if damaged in combat, target must make a second Fort save or gain the confused condition for the duration of the encounter
description: **Effect** 1d3 Wis damage and 1d3 Int damage, if damaged in combat, target must make a second Fort save or gain the confused condition for the duration of the encounter

list.name: Devil Chills
list.effect: 1d4 Str damage

list.name: Sleeping Sickness
list.effect: 1d4 Wis damage and target is fatigued
description: **Effect** 1d4 Wis damage and target is fatigued

The best cure for this disease is dosing the patient with the poison arsenic (Pathfinder RPG Core Rulebook 558)-if the patient survives, there's a cumulative 30% chance that the disease is immediately cured.

list.name: Slimy Doom
list.effect: 1d4 Con damage, target must make a second Fort save or 1 point of the damage is drain instead
description: **Effect** 1d4 Con damage, target must make a second Fort save or 1 point of the damage is drain instead

list.name: Tetanus
list.effect: 1d4 Dex. Each time someone takes Dexterity damage from tetanus, there's a 50% chance his jaw muscles stiffen, preventing speech and the use of spells with verbal components for the next 24 hours.
description: **Effect** 1d4 Dex. Each time someone takes Dexterity damage from tetanus, there's a 50% chance his jaw muscles stiffen, preventing speech and the use of spells with verbal components for the next 24 hours.

list.name: Glacier Plague
list.effect: 1d6 points of Dex damage and target is exhausted, its speed is reduced by half, and it is unable to speak
description: **Effect** 1d6 points of Dex damage and target is exhausted, its speed is reduced by half, and it is unable to speak

Known to take root in places long buried by supernatural cold, this affliction infects ruins and deep forests throughout Irrisen. It slowly freezes creatures from the inside out without dealing cold damage, so sufferers simply feel the weariness and fatigue of exerting themselves in a cold environment. The affliction reduces an affected creature's range of movement and acts in many ways like very gradual petrification. A sufferer is unable to speak, is severely slowed, and takes Dexterity damage; if the victim's Dexterity score drops below 5, it is unable to move at all. Creatures suffering from this plague don't die from it, but it often strands them out in the cold where they die from exposure.

list.name: Greenscale
list.effect: 1d2 Cha damage and 1d2 Dex damage, target must make a second Fort save or 1 point of the Cha damage is drain instead
description: **Effect** 1d2 Cha damage and 1d2 Dex damage, target must make a second Fort save or 1 point of the Cha damage is drain instead

list.name: Moxix's Delectation
list.effect: 1d3 Con and 1d3 Wis damage
description: A humanoid afflicted with Moxix's delectation must attempt a new Will save each day. If the humanoid fails, it attacks and attempts to eat the weakest humanoid nearby. If the save is successful, it resists. A humanoid who dies or is killed while afflicted rises as a ghast at the next midnight. The save DC is Charisma-based.

list.name: Red Ache
list.effect: 1d6 Str damage

list.name: Spellscar Fever
list.effect: 1d2 Con damage, 1d2 Cha drain
description: **Type** ingested or inhaled; **Fortitude Save* DC 15 (+1 per previous save)
**Ongoing Save** Fort DC equal to the save DC of the failed saving throw

Anyone who lives with spellscar fever for a week straight without dying becomes immune to the disease and to mana fever, but also becomes a Mana Waste mutant (Pathfinder Campaign Setting: Inner Sea Bestiary 28) or a mutant (Pathfinder RPG Bestiary 5 180), chosen by the GM. A Mana Waste mutant created in such a way can use the following Spellscar Fever Deformities table in place of a deformity from the Inner Sea Bestiary, while a mutant resulting from spellscar fever can take one effect from the same table in place of one deformity and one mutation.

list.name: The Tainted Plague
list.effect: 1d6 Con and 1d6 Wis
description: Even in the absence of ravening abyssal hordes, the Worldwound causes a supernatural disease called the tainted plague. Those exposed to the Worldwound or creatures native to it (including creatures already suffering ability damage from the disease) must make a DC 15 Fortitude save once per day or become infected. Those reduced to 0 Wisdom are driven mad by the mind-bending horrors they have witnessed. Those reduced to 0 Constitution perish, their bodies rotting from the inside out and dissolving within 24 hours into primordial chaos matter.

list.name: Blinding Sickness
list.effect: 1d4 Str damage, if more than 2 Str damage, target must make an additional Fort save or be permanently blinded
description: **Effect** 1d4 Str damage, if more than 2 Str damage, target must make an additional Fort save or be permanently blinded

list.name: Blood Veil
sources: Pathfinder #8: Seven Days to the Grave
list.fortitude_save: DC 16 (the first time ethnically Varisian humanoids, including human, half-elves, and half-orcs with Varisian parentage, are exposed to blood veil, each such character has a flat 5% chance that she is immune to the disease)
list.effect: 1d4 Con damage and 1d4 Cha damage
description: **Source** [Curse of the Crimson Throne pg. 431](source:Curse_of_the_Crimson_Throne), [Pathfinder #8: Seven Days to the Grave pg. 9](source:Pathfinder_#8:_Seven_Days_to_the_Grave)

**Type** contact or injury; **Fortitude Save* DC 16 (the first time ethnically Varisian humanoids, including human, half-elves, and half-orcs with Varisian parentage, are exposed to blood veil, each such character has a flat 5% chance that she is immune to the disease)

Blood veil takes its name from its most apparent symptoms: a rash and mask of blisters that cover the face. In its initial stages, the disease is characterized by headache, fatigue, coughing, and the aforementioned rash. As it progresses, the cough becomes more obtrusive; the rash spreads to the neck, face, and limbs and develops into poxlike blisters; and the lymph glands swell into painful buboes. At its most advanced stage, the blisters grow to the size of grapes or larger, internal bleeding creates black patches on the skin, and the victim expectorates blood. Ultimately, a bloody, wheezing death occurs. If left untreated, blood veil kills the average human in 7 days.

list.name: Bonechill
list.effect: 1d4 Dex damage and any nonlethal damage incurred from being in a cold environment becomes lethal damage (though it can still cause hypothermia)
description: **Effect** 1d4 Dex damage and any nonlethal damage incurred from being in a cold environment becomes lethal damage (though it can still cause hypothermia)

list.name: Boot Soup
list.effect: speed reduced by 5 feet and 1d3 Dex damage, creatures reduced to 0 feet are permanently paralyzed
list.cure: 2 consecutive saves, or completely skinning or burning the affected area (inflicting 1d8 points of damage)
description: **Effect** speed reduced by 5 feet and 1d3 Dex damage, creatures reduced to 0 feet are permanently paralyzed
**Cure** 2 consecutive saves, or completely skinning or burning the affected area (inflicting 1d8 points of damage)

list.name: Cackle Fever
list.effect: 1d6 Wis damage

list.name: Dvezda Plague
list.effect: 1d4 Con damage and 1 Dex damage
description: Days after contracting the virus, the victim becomes stricken with a high fever and begins sweating profusely. Later, the victim begins suffering from extreme tremors, followed by a thinning of the blood and bleeding from the tear ducts, nose, ears, and other orifices.

description: **Effect** 1d6 nonlethal damage and target is fatigued and staggered

list.effect: 1d2 Dex damage and 1d2 Cha damage
list.cure: 2 consecutive saves. Reptiles and creatures with the reptilian subtype receive a -2 penalty on saving throws and require 3 consecutive saves to recover.
description: **Cure** 2 consecutive saves. Reptiles and creatures with the reptilian subtype receive a -2 penalty on saving throws and require 3 consecutive saves to recover.

list.name: Bubonic Plague
list.effect: 1d4 Con damage and 1 Cha damage and target is fatigued
description: **Effect** 1d4 Con damage and 1 Cha damage and target is fatigued

list.name: Chillbane Fever
list.effect: 1d4 Con damage and target is sickened and fatigued
description: **Effect** 1d4 Con damage and target is sickened and fatigued

Not to be confused with the far more potent earlier strain that swept across Bleakmarch during the reign of Queen Velikas, this infectious disease is characterized by the sufferer's constant shaking, as though he were unable to get warm. The khala dragon (see page 59) is one known carrier of the illness, though many other forms of exposure are possible.

list.name: Firegut
list.effect: target is staggered

list.name: Demon Fever
list.effect: 1d6 Con damage, target must make a second Fort save or 1 point of the damage is drain instead
description: **Effect** 1d6 Con damage, target must make a second Fort save or 1 point of the damage is drain instead

list.name: Demonplague
list.effect: 1d3 Con damage and 1d6 Wis damage, and victim is fatigued if it takes any ability damage from the disease; certain creatures slain by demonplague rise as plagued beasts (see page 56)
description: **Effect** 1d3 Con damage and 1d6 Wis damage, and victim is fatigued if it takes any ability damage from the disease; certain creatures slain by demonplague rise as plagued beasts (see page 56)

Of the afflictions wreaked upon Sarkoris by the Worldwound and Deskari's host, the demonplague is perhaps the most insidious. This vile sickness spreads through water, affecting plant and animal life alike. In higher creatures, the demonplague causes madness and then death, but in animals and other unintelligent beasts, it continues beyond death, animating them as undead horrors called plagued beasts. The plague also twists and corrupts plant life-most of the hazardous plants detailed below are the results of normal plants becoming corrupted by the demonplague.

list.effect: 1d3 Str damage and 1d3 Con damage and target is fatigued
